messages.title: Jo Swinson's Plan for Britain's Future
messages.content: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality. Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025. Recruit 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools. Provide free childcare from 9 months and give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills and training throughout their lives. Treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.

contactInformation.address: Freepost RSTK-HJKS-EJGE, Liberal Democrats, 8-10 Great George Street, London, SW1P 3AE

quotes.text: I've worked in the regen industry for 20 years now and lately met the Liberal Democrats. They're the best plan for tackling the climate emergency. We can't afford to take the risk and pursue Brexit, and bringing about the change we so badly need.

The Conservatives have become a party of extremists, willing to ditch any principle to achieve the Brexit they want. The Liberal Democrats won't let that happen; they'll stop Brexit, but they are also strong enough to strengthen the economy.
quotes.source: Gabriel Rozenberg, Former Conservative councillor in Barnet

quotes.text: I'm backing Jol Swinson's Liberal Democrats because of their UK-wide prioritisation of mental health and social care provisions. Jo Swinson is the best leader to stop the mental health crisis that absorbs too much of the NHS's budget, and the Liberal Democrats will treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health

I'm backing Jo Swinson's Liberal Democrats. I joined as a Labour representative and councilor as the anti-Semitism in the Labour Party became intolerable. The Liberal Democrats provide the safe space needed.
